abstract: A British businessman has offered an award worth $325,000 to whoever can put forward the most elegant scenario for how a country or countries might leave the euro zone. How would Greeks swap their euros for drachmas, for example? Among Euroskeptics, the initiative by Simon Wolfson, chief executive of the British retailer Next, has caused a stir. The 425 entries have been trimmed to a shortlist of five. The winner will be announced July 5. Read more »

headline.main: An Essay Contest to Solve the Euro Crisis?
